page.title: 05Diver and Processing
page.content: INCLUDING THE SKIPPER AND A DIVER. THE SKIPPER IS OBVIOUSLY THE MOST IMPORTANT MEMBER OF THE CREW AS HE DECIDES WHERE AND WHEN TO FISH. HAVING A DIVER ON BOARD IS VERY USEFUL AS HE CAN REPAIR ANY DAMAGE UNDER WATER, SUCH AS THE NET GETTING CAUGHT IN THE PROPELLER. WHEN YOU CONSIDER THAT A PURSE SEINE NET USED BY THESE BOATS COSTS UP TO Â£100,000 HIS WORK IS OBVIOUSLY VITAL. IN THE HARBOUR FACTORIES BOTH THE PRAWNS AND FISH ARE PROCESSED. THE PRAWNS ARE GUTTED, SHELLED, FROZEN, BATTERED AND FINALLY BAGGED. FISH ARE GUTTED, SALTED AND THEN FROZEN, READY FOR EXPORT TO THE MAINLAND, NIGERIA AND EASTERN BLACK COUNTRIES.
